main_definition: The quality of being able to spread or transmit a particular condition, emotion, or behavior among others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Capable of causing infection (as with diseases) and transmitting it through contact or proximity.
meanings_and_examples.example: The flu virus is highly infectious and can easily spread from person to person.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having the ability to evoke strong emotions or reactions in others, often contagiously.
meanings_and_examples.example: Her laughter was so infectious that soon everyone around her was laughing too.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The quality of being compellingly attractive and able to draw interest or attention from others.
meanings_and_examples.example: His infectious enthusiasm for the project made his colleagues eager to contribute more.
